rows.title: Quickly Share These Resources

text.eng: Ministry of Women, Family and Community Development’s Talian Kasih 24-Hour Hotline for abuse, neglect, and violence: 15999 or SMS/WhatsApp +6-019-261-5999

rows.text: Ministry of Women, Family and Community Development’s Talian Kasih 24-Hour Hotline for abuse, neglect, and violence: 15999 or SMS/WhatsApp +6-019-261-5999

rows.title: Quickly Share These Resources

text.eng:
1️⃣ Abuse, neglect, violence, poverty, and juvenile delinquency:
Talian Kasih by Ministry Women, Family and Community Development
https://www.kpwkm.gov.my/portal-main/article?id=talian-kasih
15999 (Call)
+6-019-261-5999 (SMS or WhatsApp)

2️⃣ Abuse of women and children:
Women’s Aid Organisation (WAO)
https://wao.org.my/
+6-03-3000-8858 (Call)
+6-018-988-8058 (SMS or WhatsApp TINA)

3️⃣ Emotional distress and suicidal thoughts:
Befrienders Kuala Lumpur
https://www.befrienders.org.my/
+6-03-7627-2929 (Call)
sam@befrienders.org.my (Email)

4️⃣ Cybersecurity incident
Cyber999 by CyberSecurity Malaysia, Ministry of Communications and Multimedia (or K-KOMM)
https://www.mycert.org.my/portal/online-form?id=7a911418-9e84-4e48-84d3-aa8a4fe55f16

rows.title: Message 1: Introduction

text.eng:
😃 Hi there! Welcome to our Naungan Kasih WhatsApp Group! 

Today we are introducing ourselves and our goals for the programme! ⭐ 

My name is [INSERT NAME] and my goal is to learn more about how to help my child go to bed by 8 every night. ⏰🌙 

Please share your name and your goal for Naungan Kasih using text or audio message.

guidance.eng:
Remember to fill in your name where it says [INSERT NAME] before sending your message. 

Allow some time for parents to share. Try to praise each response.
For example, you can say “Thanks for the response, [INSERT NAME]!” or “Great goal, [INSERT NAME]”! You can also use simple emojis like 👍or 🙂

rows.title: Message 2: Setting time to chat

text.eng:
Every 2 weeks, we will catch up at [INSERT TIME] on [INSERT DAY] to chat about our Naungan Kasih journey. 

👋 Please join to share how things are going, any challenges you experience, or just say hi! 😊

⏰ Does this time and day work for everyone?

guidance.eng: Add the time and day of the week before sending the message.

rows.title: Message 3: WhatsApp Group Expectations

text.eng:
I'm really looking forward to our first chat session together! Just a quick reminder: you can chat about your experiences, challenges, and successes with each other in this group, even if our chat sessions are only once every two weeks.

This group is all about learning and sharing together! 🌟

rows.text:

rows.title: Message 4: Closing

text.eng:
😃 Thank you so much for being part of our WhatsApp chat group! 

As your home activity, try to spend at least 5 minutes of One-on-One Time with your child each day. 

We can share about how it goes during our next chat session. 

👋 See you in the next session on [ENTER DATE].

guidance.eng: Enter the date of your next chat session before sending the message.

rows.title: Message 1: Reminder

Hello! Our weekly chat is coming up! Our next chat session will be later today at [INSERT TIME]. We will catch up on how things are going with your home activities. 

See you then! 👋

guidance.eng: Send this message in the morning on the day of the chat session. Insert the time for the chat before sending the message.

rows.title: Message 2: Welcome and Check-in

text.eng:
Hello! Before we start our chat session, I just wanted to congratulate you for making it this far into the programme! ✨

How is everybody doing? 😃 Happy? 😣 Stressed? Angry? 😒 Annoyed? 💙 Peaceful? Whatever emotion you feel…it’s okay! Please share with the group how you are feeling today.

guidance.eng: Allow time for parents to share how they are feeling. You should also share how you are feeling. For example, “I am happy to be part of this chat today.”

rows.title: Message 3: Home Activity

text.eng:
Thanks for sharing! ✨

How are your NKText home activities going with your child? Did anything go particularly well? Did you find any activity difficult?

guidance.eng: Acknowledge the experiences parents share with an appropriate emoji or with a response from the common challenges.

rows.text:
Thanks for sharing! ✨

rows.title: Message 4: Supporting children’s development

text.eng:
Thanks for sharing! 

We all see how much our children grow and change over time. As parents, you have a big role in making sure your child develops and grows well. 

What do you think are some things you can do to support your child’s growth and development?

guidance.eng: Acknowledge the experiences parents share with an appropriate emoji. You can begin the discussion by sharing that parents can help their child grow by using words to describe what they are doing so that they develop language abilities.

rows.title: Message 5: Closing

text.eng:
That’s right! You can make a big difference by being involved in your child’s development. 

In NKText, you will find tips on how to support your child’s development and growth in the goal, “Understand Child Development”

If you've already given this goal a try, that's fantastic! If not, consider choosing this as your next goal. 

Thank you for sharing, and working as hard as you do as parents. See you in the next chat session on [ENTER DATE]! 🏆

guidance.eng: Enter the date of your next chat session before sending the message.

text.eng:

Remember, we are here to celebrate the good things together and help each other find solutions when things go wrong. Who would like to share first?

guidance.eng: Acknowledge the experiences parents share with an appropriate emoji or with a response from the common challenges.

rows.title: Message 4: Supporting children’s learning

text.eng:
Thanks for sharing! Last time, we talked about helping your child develop and grow. Today, let's chat about how to help your child’s learning. 

Did you know children can learn so much more through playful activities, even when they're not in school?

There are lots of ways you can use play to make learning fun for your child. They'll learn better when they're having fun!

What are some ways you can make learning fun for your child at home? 🎉

guidance.eng: Acknowledge the experiences parents share with an appropriate emoji. You can share suggestions like typing PLAY in NKText to find activities to do with your child.

rows.guidance: Acknowledge the experiences parents share with an appropriate emoji. You can share suggestions like typing PLAY in NKText to find activities to do with your child.

rows.title: Message 5: Closing

text.eng:
🎉 Those are some great ideas! 

Remember that your children will learn best when you make it fun, creative, and meaningful.

If you would like to learn more about ways to help your child grow healthily, check out the goal, “Prepare My Child for Success in School” in NKText. 

If you have already completed this goal, great job! If not, consider making this your next parenting goal. 

Remember, it is what you do at home with your child that makes the difference! 💚

Chat to you next session on [ENTER DATE]! 👀

rows.title: Message 2: Welcome and check-in

text.eng:

How is everyone’s stress level today? 

Use Type a number from 1 to 10 to share your stress level:
1 - No Stress 
2 to 5 - Some Stress 
6 to 9 - Feeling Stressed 
10 - Extremely Stressed

rows.title: Message 4: Managing stress in daily life

title.eng: Message 4: Managing stress in daily life

text.eng:
Thanks for sharing! This week we are going to focus our chat session on you 🙂

It is important that we can take care of ourselves as parents if we are going to be able to support our children. 
As we think about the last six weeks with NKText, you’ve probably noticed lots of lessons that help you take care of yourself. 

Here’s a question for you: What’s one thing you’ve learned from NKText that’s helped you take care of yourself better?

guidance.eng: Acknowledge the experiences parents share with an appropriate emoji. You can share suggestions like setting a routine helped you from the lesson “Managing Stress” in the goal “Give My Child Structure”.

rows.title: Message 5: Closing

text.eng:
🎉 Those are some great ideas! 

Remember, before you can take care of your child and family, you need to take care of yourself. 

If you want to redo any of your goals, simply type MENU in NKText. 

Next chat session will be my last chat session with you. But you can keep this WhatsApp group open* as a place to continue to support each other! 💚

Is anyone willing to take over as a group admin? 

Please send me a direct message if you are interested. It would be great to get *two volunteers*. 👀

Chat to you next session! 👀

rows.title: Message 2: Welcome

text.eng:
👋 Hi everyone, welcome to the final chat session together on Naungan Kasih. 

✨ Take a moment to think back to the beginning of the programme. How have you and your child changed?

guidance.eng: Allow parents to share about the changes that they have experienced during the programme. You can give brief words of encouragement like “Wonderful!” or “I am happy to hear that!” or even share celebration emojis like 🎉or ⭐.

rows.title: Message 3: Thank You

text.eng: Thank you for sharing your experiences. It is wonderful to see how much you have changed over the course of the programme. Remember that your parenting journey continues! 💚

rows.title: Message 4: Group Admin

text.eng: Although this is my last chat session with you, you are in good hands with your new chat group admin: [INSERT NAMES OF MODERATORS] 💙

rows.text: Although this is my last chat session with you, you are in good hands with your new chat group admin: [INSERT NAMES OF MODERATORS] 💙

rows.title: Message 5: Goodbye

text.eng:
I will now be exiting this WhatsApp Group. 👋

You are the best parents to your children *You can still complete your final NKText Goals and Skills if you have not done so yet*. 🌱

We all face difficult situations sometimes, and these final parts of NKText will help you and your child to get through them well. 

You’ve got this! ⭐ You are doing a wonderful job as a parent. It has been a pleasure to be on this journey with you!

In NKText, you will find tips on how to support your child’s development and growth in the goal, “Understand Child Development”

If you've already given this goal a try, that's fantastic! If not, consider choosing this as your next goal. 

Thank you for sharing, and working as hard as you do as parents. See you in the next chat session on [ENTER DATE]! 🏆

rows.title: Message 4: Supporting children’s learning

text.eng:
Thanks for sharing! Last time, we talked about helping your child develop and grow. Today, let's chat about how to help your child’s learning. 

Did you know children can learn so much more through playful activities, even when they're not in school?

There are lots of ways you can use play to make learning fun for your child. They'll learn better when they're having fun!

What are some ways you can make learning fun for your child at home? 🎉

guidance.eng: Acknowledge the experiences parents share with an appropriate emoji. You can share suggestions like typing PLAY in NKText to find activities to do with your child.

rows.title: Message 5: Closing

text.eng:
🎉 Those are some great ideas! 

Remember that your children will learn best when you make it fun, creative, and meaningful.

If you would like to learn more about ways to help your child grow healthily, check out the goal, “Prepare My Child for Success in School” in NKText. 

If you have already completed this goal, great job! If not, consider making this your next parenting goal. 

Remember, it is what you do at home with your child that makes the difference! 💚

Chat to you next session on [ENTER DATE]! 👀

rows.title: Message 4: Managing stress in daily life

title.eng: Message 4: Managing stress in daily life

text.eng:
Thanks for sharing! This week we are going to focus our chat session on you 🙂

It is important that we can take care of ourselves as parents if we are going to be able to support our children. 
As we think about the last six weeks with NKText, you’ve probably noticed lots of lessons that help you take care of yourself. 

Here’s a question for you: What’s one thing you’ve learned from NKText that’s helped you take care of yourself better?

guidance.eng: Acknowledge the experiences parents share with an appropriate emoji. You can share suggestions like setting a routine helped you from the lesson “Managing Stress” in the goal “Give My Child Structure”.

rows.title: Message 5: Closing

text.eng:
🎉 Those are some great ideas! 

Remember, before you can take care of your child and family, you need to take care of yourself. 

If you want to redo any of your goals, simply type MENU in NKText. 

Next chat session will be my last chat session with you. But you can keep this WhatsApp group open* as a place to continue to support each other! 💚

Is anyone willing to take over as a group admin? 

Please send me a direct message if you are interested. It would be great to get *two volunteers*. 👀

Chat to you next session! 👀

rows.title: Send this message after your WhatsApp Call

title.eng: Send this message after your WhatsApp Call

text.eng:
Hi! Thank you for volunteering to lead the group discussions. 

*While engaging with other parents in the group, keep the following in mind*: 

👋 Greet parents when engaging with them.

💛 Respect what participants share and be aware of different ages, genders, values and circumstances. 

🏅 Encourage parents to share and respond to each other - and praise them for it.

🔔 Remind parents of ground rules when needed.

🔑 Model the behaviour you want to see among the parents.

rows.title: When should the group admin respond to messages?

title.eng: When should the group admin respond to messages?

text.eng:
*When should you respond to messages?*

⏰ Participants may send messages at any time during the week. To keep your workload manageable, you can respond to messages once or twice a day, depending on your schedule. 

👍 You can also respond to messages with a relevant emoji or short response when you can.

👀 I'd like to take a moment to remind everyone about the importance of our group's ground rules. 

💚They're here to ensure that all of us feel comfortable sharing and maintain a positive environment.

❗Please keep in mind that if the ground rules aren't consistently followed, we might need to consider removing members from the WhatsApp group for the well-being of all.

See you in the next chat session.

rows.title: Message of Support

text.eng:
Hello 👋

Thank you for sharing your thoughts about the programme. I’m sorry that you’re facing challenges. Here are a couple of things you can try: 

1️⃣If there’s a skill or goal that you are finding difficult, remember you can always go back to it by typing MENU. Practice makes perfect! ✨

2️⃣If you feel comfortable, please feel free to chat about the areas you’re finding tough with your peers in the WhatsApp Support Group. Your peers might have some helpful tips 👍

Remember, everyone’s learning journey is unique, and change takes time. But trust me, if you keep practising the skills you’ve learned, you’ll start to see progress. 🏅

rows.title: Message of Support

text.eng:
Hello 👋

Thank you for sharing your feelings. 
It’s okay to have fears or feel sad when something you’ve been a part of is ending. 

Remember, 

1️⃣Even though Naungan Kasih is ending, your journey can continue. You have gained some ⭐amazing ⭐parenting skills that you can carry with you. 

2️⃣The WhatsApp group can be a source of support well beyond the programme. Keep sharing your success and struggles in the WhatsApp Support Group, or with your peers. 

3️⃣If you ever want to go back to any parenting skills or goals, you can type MENU. Practise makes perfect ✨

You did great throughout your NKText journey!

rows.title: I didn’t have enough time to spend one-on-one time.

title.eng: I didn’t have enough time to spend one-on-one time.

text.eng: Thank you for sharing. It can be hard to find time, especially when you have work, chores, and other responsibilities to do. 😔 You could try finding a chore to do together.

rows.text: Thank you for sharing. It can be hard to find time, especially when you have work, chores, and other responsibilities to do. 😔 You could try finding a chore to do together.

rows.title: My child did not want to spend time with me.

title.eng: My child did not want to spend time with me.

text.eng: Thank you for sharing. It feels sad when your child doesn't want to spend time with you. 😔 Try suggesting a fun activity to do together.

rows.text: Thank you for sharing. It feels sad when your child doesn't want to spend time with you. 😔 Try suggesting a fun activity to do together.

rows.title: All my child wanted to do was watch T.V. or play with a gadget.

title.eng: All my child wanted to do was watch T.V. or play with a gadget.

text.eng:
It can be tough when your child seems focused on watching TV or playing with a gadget all the time. 😟 

To connect with them and understand their interests, try asking them to show you something cool on the gadget. 

It's a simple way to engage with their world and spend time together. 📺

It's a simple way to engage with their world and spend time together. 📺

rows.title: My child did not want one-on-one time to end.

title.eng: My child did not want one-on-one time to end.

text.eng:
I understand it can be tough when your child does not want one-on-one time to end. 😣

To make things smoother, try being clear about how much time you have together and give a gentle warning when the time is about to end. ⏰

To help you with managing your child’s behaviour, consider making “Support My Child’s Positive Behaviour” as your next parenting goal once you finish your current goal.

rows.title: My child wanted to do activities that I could not do.

title.eng: My child wanted to do activities that I could not do.

text.eng:
I can imagine it's challenging when your child wants to do activities that you find difficult. 😔

 A simple solution is to ask your child if you can join in by watching. 

This way, you're still involved and supportive, even if you can't participate directly. 🤝

rows.title: I forgot to praise my child.

title.eng: I forgot to praise my child.

text.eng:
💚 It can be difficult to juggle all the different things we need to do. 

🌱 Next time you spend one-on-one time, try and think of one thing you can praise them for. 

☀️ You can even say, “Thank you for spending time with me!”

rows.title: I felt embarrassed or weird when praising my child.

title.eng: I felt embarrassed or weird when praising my child.

text.eng:
⭐ It’s normal to feel uneasy about doing new things.

🌷 This is especially true of praise when we are not used to hearing it ourselves. 

👀 But it will get easier with practice,I promise!

text.eng:

💡 Find a simple behaviour that your child does that you are happy about and tell them. Even something that they already do. 

♥️ It will make a difference!

rows.title: My child did not want to share their emotions.

title.eng: My child did not want to share their emotions.

text.eng:
💚 I understand that sharing feelings is challenging when it’s new. 

🌱 Be patient and keep providing them with the opportunity to start sharing. 

☀️ Be a model for your children by sharing your own feelings.

rows.title: I felt uncomfortable talking about my own feelings

title.eng: I felt uncomfortable talking about my own feelings

text.eng:
⭐ It's okay to feel uncomfortable talking about your own feelings. 

👀 A simple way to start is by using 'I feel...' 

🌷 For example, you could say, "I feel happy when we spend time together." Starting small like this can make it easier.

title.eng: Others in the household don’t think it’s a good idea to talk about emotions.

text.eng:
🔔 You can try talking to them about why it might be a good idea. 

💡 Encourage them to try it first. Sometimes, just giving it a try can help everyone understand each other better.

text.eng:

💡 Encourage them to give it a try! Talking openly about feelings can help everyone understand each other better.

rows.title: I don’t know how to name some of the feelings I am experiencing.

title.eng: I don’t know how to name some of the feelings I am experiencing.

text.eng:
✨ Naming feelings can be tough. 

🔄 Try combining words you know, like happy or sad, and think about where you feel it in your body. 

🔴 For example, if your chest feels tight, it might be stress. 

🔶 It's okay not to have all the words – describe it the best you can.

rows.title: I don’t have time to interact with my child.

title.eng: I don’t have time to interact with my child.

text.eng:
It is okay to feel that way. But there are many small ways to spend time with your child!

⏰ You can interact with your child while doing something else. Like, try asking your child to describe the colours and objects they see around them while you are walking together or while commuting on a bus.

😃 Your child will appreciate the attention you are giving, even for a short while.

rows.title: My child is not interested in spending time with me.

title.eng: My child is not interested in spending time with me.

text.eng:
😣 You may be hurt because your child does not want to spend time with you.

⏰ Sometimes, your child just needs time to engage with you. It helps to remain calm, patient, and kind while you try to connect with your child.

🌱 As children grow, they may want independence from you. That’s normal! You can support them to find friends based on their interests.

⏰ Sometimes, your child just needs time to engage with you. It helps to remain calm, patient, and kind while you try to connect with your child.

🌱 As children grow, they may want independence from you. That’s normal! You can support them to find friends based on their interests.

rows.title: My child keeps getting hurt from exploring or making new friends.

title.eng: My child keeps getting hurt from exploring or making new friends.

text.eng:
🧸 It must be hard to see your child getting injured or feeling sad. 

🌷 Children learn and grow from making mistakes. It is an important part of child development. They will be safe as long as you are aware of their activities and you can prevent anything dangerous.

⭐ Build your child’s confidence about their abilities, values, and appearance so that they are comfortable trying new things.

🎨 Encourage them to safely try out fun activities with other kids or adults. Praise them when they do it well!

💚 Let your child know that you trust them to be safe and follow the rules that you have set.

rows.title: My children will think I am not strong if I share my own mistakes.

title.eng: My children will think I am not strong if I share my own mistakes.

text.eng:
💚 It’s completely normal to feel worried about how your children might see you if you share your mistakes. 

🏆 Sharing your mistakes shows your child how you have learned and grown from your mistake, and they can do the same. 

⭐ It shows your children how you are stronger after learning your mistakes.

rows.title: I don’t know what to do during play time with my child.

title.eng: I don’t know what to do during play time with my child.

text.eng:
💙 I understand that figuring out what to do during playtime with your child can be challenging. 

🌱 It's a common concern, and you're not alone. 

💡 If you need ideas for activities, simply type PLAY in NKText

rows.title: I did not find time to help my child learn.

title.eng: I did not find time to help my child learn.

text.eng:
It can be difficult to find time to help your child learn, but there are two important things to remember:

1️⃣ Your child can learn a lot just by joining in activities you do in your normal routine. Going shopping for food, sorting clothes, and cooking are great opportunities to talk to your child and for them to learn. 
🍅 Describe what you are doing and ask questions. If you can, play counting games, and point out numbers, shapes and letters that you see. For example, square signs and round signs, and numbers and letters on labels. 🔷 🔵

2️⃣ You can help your child learn by spending just a short amount of time specifically on a learning activity. For example, can you find 5 minutes in the evening to look at pictures together or read a children’s book? 📖

rows.text:
It can be difficult to find time to help your child learn, but there are two important things to remember:

1️⃣ Your child can learn a lot just by joining in activities you do in your normal routine. Going shopping for food, sorting clothes, and cooking are great opportunities to talk to your child and for them to learn. 
🍅 Describe what you are doing and ask questions. If you can, play counting games, and point out numbers, shapes and letters that you see. For example, square signs and round signs, and numbers and letters on labels. 🔷 🔵

2️⃣ You can help your child learn by spending just a short amount of time specifically on a learning activity. For example, can you find 5 minutes in the evening to look at pictures together or read a children’s book? 📖

rows.title: I didn’t have any books to read with my child.

title.eng: I didn’t have any books to read with my child.

text.eng:
💡 That’s normal! Many parents don’t have books in the house. 

👀 You can also use anything that has pictures to interact with your child - magazines, newspapers, and even signs on the road.

rows.text:
💡 That’s normal! Many parents don’t have books in the house. 

👀 You can also use anything that has pictures to interact with your child - magazines, newspapers, and even signs on the road.

rows.title: My child does not want to learn.

title.eng: My child does not want to learn.

text.eng:
🎨 Try to make learning activities fun! Your child will be more likely to want to learn when the activity is fun with less pressure. 

⚽ Follow your child’s interests, even if you’re just talking together. This will help them learn. 

📱 For playful, educational ideas, type {PLAY} at any time in your NKText!

rows.title: I am feeling overwhelmed.

text.eng:
💙 I’m sorry you’re feeling overwhelmed. 

💡 Try doing short, simple, and fun things that can fit in with your routine. 

🌈 For example, point at things like letters, numbers, colours, and objects and tell Your Child what they are. Start slowly and simply. 

🍚 If you’re busy, just involve your child in what you are doing.

title.eng: My child did not follow instructions even when I followed the tips.

text.eng: 💙 I understand it can be challenging when your child doesn't follow instructions. Remember, children need time to learn these skills. Be patient with the process, and don't hesitate to try again.🌱

instruction.

instructions – but it’s worth trying again! Try
thinking about the behaviour you would like to see your child to more often and think of positive ways to give that instruction. 🌷

me.

me.

text.eng:
⭐ It can be tough when your child doesn't listen. 

👀 Try getting their attention by looking at them or gently touching their shoulder before telling them something. That might help them hear you better.

rows.title:
My child had difficulty following my
instructions.

title.eng:
My child had difficulty following my
instructions.

text.eng:
It's hard when your child struggles to follow what you ask. 

1️⃣ Try giving just one instruction at a time, something they can easily do. And remember to give them enough time to do it. This can make following instructions easier for them.

rows.title: We were not able to stick to the rule or routine

title.eng: We were not able to stick to the rule or routine

text.eng: Try making a rule or routine that's easy to follow, like cleaning up toys after playing. This way, it's simpler for everyone to keep up with it.

rows.text: Try making a rule or routine that's easy to follow, like cleaning up toys after playing. This way, it's simpler for everyone to keep up with it.

rows.title: My child struggled to go along with the bedtime routine.

title.eng: My child struggled to go along with the bedtime routine.

text.eng: It takes time for children to learn new routines and change their behaviour. Be patient and keep the bedtime routine consistent.

rows.text: It takes time for children to learn new routines and change their behaviour. Be patient and keep the bedtime routine consistent.

rows.title: My child and I could not agree on a rule.

title.eng: My child and I could not agree on a rule.

text.eng:
Think about whether the rule is reasonable. Can your child do it? 

It helps when making rules as a family to think about your child, how old they are
and what really matters to them.

rows.text:
Think about whether the rule is reasonable. Can your child do it? 

It helps when making rules as a family to think about your child, how old they are
and what really matters to them.

rows.title: My child felt it was unfair that I don’t have to follow the rule we set.

title.eng: My child felt it was unfair that I don’t have to follow the rule we set.

text.eng:
We should always remember that children learn best from us. The more we follow the rules, the more they will follow the rules too. 

You can adjust the rule to make sure that it is realistic for everyone to follow it, considering their and your responsibilities (for example school or work activities).

rows.text:
We should always remember that children learn best from us. The more we follow the rules, the more they will follow the rules too. 

You can adjust the rule to make sure that it is realistic for everyone to follow it, considering their and your responsibilities (for example school or work activities).

rows.title: Parent should be the one setting the rule, not the child.

title.eng: Parent should be the one setting the rule, not the child.

text.eng:
When we establish rules together with our
children, that helps the family to understand each other better.

 The rules will be more realistic and children will be more willing and able to follow the rules.

children, that helps the family to understand each other better.

rows.title: We made the rule but my child does not follow it.

title.eng: We made the rule but my child does not follow it.

text.eng:
I get that it's challenging when your child isn't following the rule you set. 😔

Think about your rule – is it fair and realistic? What can your child actually do? Adjust the rule, if necessary. 

Praise your child when they do follow the rule.

rows.title: I am too angry to find anything positive to say to my child after they have misbehaved.

title.eng: I am too angry to find anything positive to say to my child after they have misbehaved.

text.eng: Take a deep breath, take some space, and then pick something very small and concrete that you wish your child could do more of that you can praise in your child.

rows.text: Take a deep breath, take some space, and then pick something very small and concrete that you wish your child could do more of that you can praise in your child.

rows.title: My child doesn’t seem to have changed their behaviour despite the consequence I put in place.

title.eng: My child doesn’t seem to have changed their behaviour despite the consequence I put in place.

text.eng: It takes time for anyone’s behaviour to change. Remember to consistently apply the consequence – you need to do it every time – and to put it into place immediately.

rows.text: It takes time for anyone’s behaviour to change. Remember to consistently apply the consequence – you need to do it every time – and to put it into place immediately.

rows.title: My child is misbehaving all the time.

title.eng: My child is misbehaving all the time.

text.eng: You may need to spend more One-on-One Time with your child and give more positive attention to them when they are behaving well. This takes time so be patient!
